data.title: Celebration
data.text: We had a nice evening out celebrating an event. Our choice to have the Pirogue experience as part of the celebration.

data.title: Pirogue Grille
data.text: Excellent service and the was food was attractive to the eye. The entrée was delicious!! Would recommend to anyone who wants to experience fine dining with great pricing.

data.title: Dinner for two
data.text: I've been to this restaurant a few times in three years. It doesn't disappoint with its eclectic menu of tastes and fresh food. Recently tried a freekeh salad with sweet potato and grapes...very nice flavor combo. Service has always been consistent and good. Ambiance is tasteful. Good for a dinner date.

data.title: Great amazing service.
data.text: Our server Brandi was amazing. She took extra care to ensure our courses were impeccably timed. The only complaint I had was that they need to use a better quality pasta for the pheasant pasta. Other than that our food was exceptional. The smoked salmon cakes and the baked Alaska were amazing.

data.title: A night out or special occasion destination!!
data.text: We've been here many times over the years. Always awesome food & service!! Special occasions are celebrated here!!

data.title: Great dinner
data.text: I received wonderful service here, and I loved my entree! It was scallops in a curry sauce with rice. The ingredients are locally sourced, and it really makes a difference. I definitely recommend you to eat here while in Bismarck. Save room for the amazing cheesecake!

data.title: Friends celebrating their Amniversary
data.text: What a delight to see the use of so many local or regional items on the menu.  Stuart and Cheryl have a diverse food menu as well as the wine list.  We tried multiple items and a few favorites were the Rabbit and Pot Sticker Apps and the Chokechery Chocolate ice cream.    Entrees were equally delicious and good portions; Salmon, Scallops and Pork Chop.   Great downtown location and atmosphere.  A real treat!

data.title: Surprising menu
data.text: What a wide and varying. Menu, did not order either the Elk or Bison as have them regularly at home, but people eating close to us said was great.  Appetizer included a Walleye trio -- fixed three different ways, was great. With dessert make sure your order the French press coffee

data.title: Absolutely awesome
data.text: I don't why I don't just come eat here all the time. This place is just beyond fabulous. The best food in Bismarck by far. Scallops wowza

data.title: Great service, amazing food!
data.text: My hubby and I went again on Saturday night to celebrate our 44th anniversary, it was the place I picked because each time we have been there the food was excellent, the service impeccable.  It is the place we go for all the special occasions in our lives.  We have never been disappointed!!  Always treated like royalty!!

data.title: Best bison!
data.text: Wow! What a delightful surprise to find such an excellent restaurant. We chose to try the bison. They swapped the offered barley to dill mashed potatoes for us. The portion was ample enough for us to share. It also came with fresh mixed vegetables. We also ordered the spinach salad. the meal ended by thier giving us a sweet of a spiced caramel popcorn. Everything was fresh... cooked to perfection... and delicious. Very nice atmosphere too. Service was great. Definitely a great fine dining place to visit often.

data.title: Wonderful splurge of a meal
data.text: This meal can easily cost you $50 to $70 a person but oh is it good. Regional cuisine like  venison sausage, bison medallions, walleye mix with traditional options like chicken and shrimp. Every dish was excellent. This is really a special occasion romantic spot or for high power business deals but they seem accustomed to travelers too and welcomed us even though we were casually dressed in jeans.

data.title: Amazing anniversary dinner
data.text: My husband and I visited the Pirogue Grille Saturday night for our 20th Wedding Anniversary. Neither of us had ever been to the restaurant before, but my husband heard great reviews, so we decided to try it out. What a fantastic place in the heart of downtown Bismarck! The atmosphere is very upscale and romantic. The food is delicious. We started our evening out with the chicken and peanut pot stickers - wow!! So good! We each had salads - mine was the beet salad with goat cheese and pecans - very unique, but so delicious - my mouth is watering just thinking about it. For my entree I chose the walleye - again, cooked to perfection - just so amazing! My husband had a beef dish and he, too, really enjoyed it. For dessert we ordered the sampler - wow! Not that we needed anymore food, because the servings were generous, but the desserts were amazing. Everything was so nice - we had such a wonderful dinner. Our waitress was very helpful and knowledgeable about everything on the menu and so kind and bubbly. She went out of her way to wish us a happy anniversary - as did several of the other staff members. It really made our evening special. We will definitely return to the Pirogue Grille to try other items on the menu. It is so nice to have a restaurant like this to go out for special occasions. What a treat!

data.title: not sure about this place
data.text: three adults and a child rack up a bill of over 200 bucks.  They put berries in the crem, never saw that and didnt enjoy it.  definitely didnt get bang for our buck.

data.title: Date night 8/27
data.text:
I took my fiancé out for a nice dinner for her birthday and we had a wonderful time. our Sever was very knowledgeable and friendly. He helped us with suggestions about the daily specials and didn't bug us when we were talking. He did and excellent job. I'm not sure of his name, but he is the blonde gentleman  from California. 
the food was wonderful.

data.title: Great chef on top of their game
data.text: The Pirogue offers fine dining with a prairie twist. We enjoyed every dish, but the venison sausage, pork chops, and strawberry rhubarb tart were all stand outs. Service was friendly and efficient, our booth was quite comfortable, and the wine/ beer/ cocktail list was expansive. Just when we thought we couldn't possibly eat another bite, a complimentary dish of fresh popcorn with cardamom and caramel arrived with the check. Too delicious to pass up!

data.title: Unique Appetizers
data.text:
After reading other TA reviews, and knowing we had an evening in Bismarck, this was the restaurant we wanted to try.  The appetizer menu captivated me and I opted for choosing chicken and peanut potstickers, another using rabbit meat, a cup of gazpacho, and a beet salad.  All were very good, but the potstickers were the best!  And I've eaten my share over the years. I really wanted to try the venison sausage, but I was already full!  My husband had and excellent Caesar  salad and a bison steak entrée.  The bison was delicious.  We topped the meal off with a very good Crème Brulee.  The chef, obviously, is creative and a treasure but our waitress was outstanding as well.

Although this place seemed to be a bit more on the fine dining side, and a date night sort of place, we were treated like royalty in our casual dress for and early dinner.

data.title: Words can not describe!
data.text: Cheryl will great you at the door with a smile. We have never had a bad meal; we especially love the specials Stuart creates. The staff have been fun and always up for a challenge. Love the Bison!

data.title: Special place for family celebrations!
data.text: Our family chooses this restaurant for special celebrations for a number of reasons, mainly their diverse menu choices, excellent service and delicious food.  Their desserts are a special treat as well.  The atmosphere is warm and reasonably quiet so we can visit.  I recommend this restaurant wholeheartedly!

data.title: An unexpected pleasure.
data.text: I got the impression from reviews that it was above average but I was surprised to find it first rate, on a par with better restaurants in NYC, Boston and Portland, OR.  Heirloom tomatoes with mozzarella to start were superb.  I had a choice of bison "New York cut" steak or bison tenderloin medallions.  I had the latter with an amazing wine sauce.  Chocolate tart with chocolate icing and raspberry sauce was as good as any I've had.  I can't tell you about the wine but the coffee was excellent.
